node.title: Radical Candor: Be a Kick-ass Boss Without Losing Your Humanity
node.author: Kim Scott
node.description: Whether you are a boss, or have one you need to read this book. Its simple framework of challenging directly and caring personally is really powerful. I've thought I was being radically candor when I was obnoxuiously aggressive and by reading this amazing book I now know the difference and how to progress from undesired behaviour to desired one.

node.title: Anything You Want: 40 Lessons for a New Kind of Entrepreneur
node.author: Derek Sivers
node.description: This short book (which if you put your mind to it can be read in a couple of hours) is so filled with great advice that I implore you to read it multiple times. Derek Sivers, the creator of CD Baby is describing his success and his failures in a series of short lessons where each one has a great takeaway. Some of the best quotes for me are "Success comes from persistently improving and inventing, not from persistently doing what's not working" and "No 'yes'. Either 'Hell yeah!' or 'no.'"

node.title: Never Split The Difference: Negotiating As If Your Life Depended On It
node.author: Chris Voss
node.description: One of the best books on the subject of negotiation with a lot of examples of how to use the knowledge in your daily life. Not just for negotiating hostage situations. I've been using some of the tips when I'm 'negotiating' dinner plans with my girlfriend and so far I've been 100% successful :-)

node.title: Tiny Habits: The Small Changes That Change Everything
node.author: BJ Fogg
node.description: As I've read the Atomic Habits by James Clear earlier, I was aware of the importance of starting small but, I just wasn't aware how small (or tiny) can you go. The principle of B = MAP (behavior = motivation * ability * prompt) is explained in several ways in the book and the methods accompanying it are brilliant. There are 300 tiny habits and the end of the book to get inspired with and, they are very useful.

node.title: Atomic Habits
node.author: James Clear
node.description: Excellent book for those who want to learn how to form good habits easily or break bad ones. Also, its 1% compounding effect  description is amazing, inspirational and motivational.

node.title: Why We Sleep
node.author: Matthew Walker
node.description: Highly recommended book to gain insights into sleep and its value. You'll re-think late night alcohol beverages, Netflix binges and staring at screens :) Somewhat disturbing facts which some articles already disproved so take everything with a grain of salt (or two).

node.title: Sapiens: A brief history of humankind
node.author: Yuval Noah Harari
node.description: Interesting take on history of the world in which history and philosophy mix to create tantalizing read.
